name: St. Kuriakose Elias Chavara

locations.description: Indian Syro-Malabar Catholic priest, founder of the Carmelites of Mary Immaculate

summary: Kuriakose Elias Chavara was an Indian Syro-Malabar Catholic priest and social reformer. He co-founded the Carmelites of Mary Immaculate, the first indigenous religious congregation for men in India. He worked for the education of women, established schools and printing presses, and promoted social reforms. He is venerated as a saint in the Syro-Malabar Church.
